Omar Alrawi






Omar Alrawi is a Sr. Software Engineer working on workload classification and workload placement using hardware performance counters and cache partitioning/monitoring technology.

Omar graduated with his BS in math and computer science from Purdue University. He went on to get his Masterâ€™s degree in information security from CERIAS. Omar worked for several companies before joining QCRI, including Verisign Inc., Booz Allen Hamilton, and Cisco Systems.

Publication

  1. Omar Alrawi*, Aziz Mohaisen; Chains of Distrust: Towards Understanding Certificates Used for Signing Malicious Applications, in proceedings WWW 2016 Companion, 2016
  2. Omar Alrawi*, Aziz Mohaisen*; Behavior-based Automated Malware Analysis and Classification, Elsevier Computers & Security, 2015
  3. A Mohaisen, AG West, A Mankin, O Alrawi; Chatter: Classifying Malware Families Using System Event Ordering. IEEE CNS 2014
  4. Omar Alrawi*, Aziz Mohaisen*; AMAL: High-Fidelity, Behavior-based Automated Malware Analysis and Classification. WISA 2014. Best Paper.
  5. Omar Alrawi* Aziz Mohaisen*; AV-Meter: An Evaluation of Antivirus Scans and Labels. DIMVA 2014.
  6. Aziz Mohaisen, Omar Alrawi, Andrew G. West, and Allison Mankin; Babble: Identifying Malware by Its Dialects. IEEE CNS 2013.
  7. Aziz Mohaisen, Omar Alrawi, Matt Larson, and Danny McPherson; Towards A Methodical Evaluation of Antivirus Scans and Labels. WISA 2013.
  8. Omar Alrawi* Aziz Mohaisen*; Unveiling Zeus Automated Classification of Malware Samples. WWW Workshops 2013.

* contributed equally

Patents

  • Systems and methods for behavior-based automated malware analysis and classification
